Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: செப்பின் புணர்ச்சிபோல் கூடினும் கூடாதே உட்பகை உற்ற குடி.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Never indeed will a family subject to internal hatred unite (really) though it may present an apparent union like that of a casket and its lid.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A family that suffers from internal hatred ('உட்பகை உற்ற குடி') is shown standing together, putting on an appearance of unity for the outside world.
Layered_Composition.Midground: Their apparent unity is compared to a beautiful, ornate casket with its lid ('செப்பின் புணர்ச்சி'). The lid fits perfectly on the box, and from the outside, they seem to be a single, unified object.
Layered_Composition.Background: However, a surreal, see-through view reveals the truth. Although the lid and box are touching, they are not truly joined. A venomous serpent is coiled in the gap between them, showing that there is no true union ('கூடாதே'), only a dangerous and deceptive surface-level contact.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A family with internal hatred, even if they seem to be together, can never be truly united, just as a casket and its lid are two separate things that merely touch.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The casket and lid are the central analogy for a superficial union. The hidden serpent represents the active hatred that prevents true unity.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The outside of the casket is beautiful and polished. The interior view reveals the dark, venomous serpent, lit with a sickly, sinister light.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A shot that shows the perfect exterior of the casket, with a surreal cutaway to reveal the serpent hidden in the join.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with rich, ornate detail on the casket.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Contrasting lighting for the exterior and interior.
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: Surrealism, with a focus on symbolic objects.
